page.title: 13Conservation - Eastchurch
page.content: The whole of the area has suffered greatly from the effects of Dutch Elm disease, resulting in the existence of very few{trees}of any kind. The initiative for tree planting rests with those individuals with a conscience. Some of the farmers are concerned with the{ecology,}one of whom has planted five hundred saplings on his land in recent years. Some have refrained from{crop spraying in order to allow wild plants and animals to survive. Many farmers have retained{hedge}boundaries for this reason. A small copse of oak trees is guarded as it is unusual for these trees to grow in this area.
